key_events.description: Dividend for December (paid in January 2026) was R$ 0.70 per share.
Monthly dividend of BRL 0.8000 per share payable on January 15, 2026, ex-date on January 02, 2026 and record date on December 30, 2025 was announced.
The mark-to-market rate increased to IPCA + 9.93%.

risk_factors: Exposure to real estate ventures through CRIs.
Fluctuations in IPCA and real interest rates.

investment_thesis.bull_case: KNIP11 offers exposure to a well-diversified portfolio of real estate-related fixed income assets, particularly CRIs, with a target return of IMA-B plus 0.50% per year. The fund's large net worth, high allocation to target assets (103.1%), and attractive dividend yield (11.07% for the last 12 months) make it an appealing investment. BTG Pactual has a buy recommendation with a target price of R$ 95.00.
investment_thesis.bear_case: The fund's exposure to CRIs and real estate ventures carries inherent risks. The management fee of 1.00% per year could impact returns. The fund's allocation to the office sector (31.8%) and shopping malls (31.2%) may be vulnerable to market fluctuations. Trading at R$ 92.40 with a book value per share of R$ 92.65 (P/VP of 0.99) suggests limited upside.

summary_markdown: KNIP11's dividend for December 2025 was R$ 0.70 per share. A monthly dividend of BRL 0.8000 per share payable on January 15, 2026 was announced. The mark-to-market rate increased to IPCA + 9.93%. BTG Pactual has a buy recommendation with a target price of R$ 95.00. As of 2026-01-28, KNIP11 was trading at R$ 92.40 with a book value per share of R$ 92.65. The dividend yield for the last 12 months is 11.07%.
